title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content: jose\_\_ joined #xwiki at 00:27 phancox joined #xwiki at 00:29 rrodriguez\_ left at 01:12 (Quit: rrodriguez\_ phancox left at 01:32 (Remote host closed the connection lucaa left at 01:35 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds abusenius left at 04:30 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds venkatesh joined #xwiki at 06:07 venkatesh left at 06:08 (Client Quit venkatesh joined #xwiki at 06:08 rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 07:01 mflorea joined #xwiki at 07:03 silviar joined #xwiki at 07:03 Denis left at 07:04 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds Denis joined #xwiki at 07:09 asrfel joined #xwiki at 07:17 vmassol joined #xwiki at 07:18 sdumitriu left at 07:18 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds vmassol left at 07:20 (Client Quit kibahop joined #xwiki at 08:08 florinciu joined #xwiki at 08:21 sburjan joined #xwiki at 08:28 silviar left at 08:28 (Quit: Leaving. kibahop left #xwiki at 08:35 florinciu left at 08:39 (Read error: Connection reset by peer SvenDowideit left at 09:05 (Changing host SvenDowideit joined #xwiki at 09:05 rrodriguez left at 09:11 (Quit: rrodriguez sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 09:12 arkub joined #xwiki at 09:20 tmortagne joined #xwiki at 09:23 silviar joined #xwiki at 09:27 silviar left at 09:40 (Quit: Leaving. kwoot joined #xwiki at 09:42 kwoot - (09:43): Could it be that in xwiki 2.2.5 there is a major bug including attached jpeg or png images in a page? As in, they don't show up in preview or saved page? silviar joined #xwiki at 09:47 cjdelisle - (09:49): kwoot: Are you using mysql and are the very small images ok? cjdelisle - (09:50): If so, it's probably the mysql max\_packet\_size cjdelisle - (09:51): The image fails to save but the sneaky cache fools you...  until you restart the wiki engine. cjdelisle - (09:51): Cache coherency should be fixed in 2.5 kwoot - (09:55): Thanks for the hint. I will let dba know about this. kwoot - (09:57): Thinking about it.  Actually we currently use Oracle for the db. the attachments at the bottom seem fine, but I can only imclude with the 'image:' tag and not with the '[[image:file||options]]´ tag. cjdelisle - (09:58): Hmm. definitely not the mysql issue then. kwoot - (09:59): nope. did a mogrify of jpeg files to png but no change. tmortagne - (10:00): kwoot: could you look at what is the difference in the produced html when you use image:file or [[image:file]], it's supposed to be the same thing so I don't understand why one works when the other does not kwoot - (10:01): sure. one moment kwoot - (10:01): btw, using google chrome/ kwoot - (10:03): kwoot - (10:03): they seem fine. after edit the first image shows up as a html-broken-image/image-not-found link. But during edit they seem fine. Strange. tmortagne - (10:04): both html image are the ok and the same except the height/with parameter, does it works if you don't put any parameter ? tmortagne - (10:05): maybe chrome has some bugs percent resizing or something kwoot - (10:05): Main/AllDocs?view=attachments shows no attachments in the wiki. Strange? kwoot - (10:06): Maybe upload dir access rights? tmortagne - (10:07): if image:file works it has nothing to do with the attachment itself i think flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 10:07 kwoot - (10:09): very, very strange. just started firefox. Images show up in the page and seems to work. mihaipaun joined #xwiki at 10:09 sburjan - (10:10): hello tmortagne. It  seems a bug has been found. florinciu joined #xwiki at 10:11 sburjan - (10:11): I enabled OfficeImporter, I connected, and the AttachmentsTab from botton gives an error. sburjan - (10:11): \*bottom sburjan - (10:11): Error number 4001 in 4: Error while parsing velocity page /templates/attachmentsinline.vm Wrapped Exception: Failed to evaluate content with id [/templates/attachmentsinline.vm] tmortagne - (10:11): sburjan: which version are you talking about ? sburjan - (10:12): latest snapshot from trunk. (today's snapshot) tmortagne - (10:12): could you get the full error, the first part is generally not very helpful cjdelisle - (10:13): Maybe pastebin it? tmortagne - (10:13): yes sburjan - (10:13): 2 secs sburjan - (10:13): http://pastebin.com/Wd7mMsfH cjdelisle - (10:14): ailed to locate Script Service [officeviewer] tmortagne - (10:14): that's very weird tmortagne - (10:14): i doubt this service is new cjdelisle - (10:15): renamed from officepreview sburjan - (10:15): florinciu: confirms it too tmortagne - (10:15): sburjan: could you look if you have office-preview jar in /lib folder ? tmortagne - (10:15): cjdelisle: yes probably something wrong happen during the rename tmortagne - (10:16): mflorea: any idea before i check ? sburjan - (10:16): tmortagne: I don't have it tmortagne - (10:17): sburjan: ok so that's it, need to find why now mflorea - (10:18): tmortagne: let me check tmortagne - (10:18): found mflorea - (10:18): ? tmortagne - (10:18): it's still the old name in xwik-core tmortagne - (10:18): depedencies tmortagne - (10:18): no tmortagne - (10:19): it's not tmortagne - (10:19): was looking at the wrong version tmortagne - (10:19): so it's properly set as xwiki-core dependency tmortagne - (10:19): so i don't understand why it's not in XE tmortagne - (10:20): sburjan: are you really sure you don't have it ? tmortagne - (10:20): it's xwiki-core-office-importer sburjan - (10:20): sorinello@Phoenix:~/Desktop/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-2.5-SNAPSHOT/webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib$ ls  |grep office sburjan - (10:20): xwiki-core-office-importer-2.5-SNAPSHOT.jar flaviusolaru1 joined #xwiki at 10:20 sburjan - (10:20): of .. I have this tmortagne - (10:21): ok so that's another issue then mflorea - (10:21): that's the importer, you need the office-viewer tmortagne - (10:22): yes i read too quickly tmortagne - (10:22): mflorea: so maybe office-viewer hasn't been added as core dependency sburjan - (10:22): well .. this is the only jar that has "office" in the name .. from /lib mflorea - (10:23): tmortagne: xwiki-core doesn't need it, adding the dependency there is wrong IMO tmortagne - (10:23): that's also the only one in xwiki-core pom.xml tmortagne - (10:23): mflorea: there is plenty of not needed dependecnie in xwiki-core tmortagne - (10:23): i know it's wrong tmortagne - (10:23): but xwiki-core itself is wrong jvdrean joined #xwiki at 10:23 mflorea - (10:23): :) tmortagne - (10:23): we are using it as meta dependency flaviusolaru left at 10:23 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds mflorea - (10:24): ok, I see. I'll add the dependency and a comment tmortagne - (10:24): since office-importer is there lets put the viewer too mflorea - (10:24): let me do it quickly tmortagne - (10:24): ok fmancinelli joined #xwiki at 10:26 flaviusolaru1 left at 10:27 (Quit: Leaving. flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 10:31 SvenDowideit\_ joined #xwiki at 10:36 SvenDowideit left at 10:38 (Ping timeout: 272 seconds SvenDowideit\_ is now known as SvenDowideit ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) sburjan - (10:38): there is also an important issue .. that maybe we will fix in 2.5 final ... It seems that JODConverter is unable to properly detect the path of xoffice in order to start it (when Internal Managed mode is selected) vmassol joined #xwiki at 10:38 vmassol - (10:39): so guys what's the status of the release? vmassol - (10:39): I didn't see an announcement mail! vmassol - (10:39): :) vmassol - (10:39): tests failing? something else? vmassol - (10:39): where can I help? sburjan - (10:40): not yet .. I found a bug sburjan - (10:40): or something that is wrong vmassol - (10:40): blocking bug? tmortagne - (10:41): sburjan: JODConverter is not always able to detect xoffice path, i don't know for Windows but it never worked on ubuntu for example tmortagne - (10:41): so this is not really new sburjan - (10:41): tmortagne: yeah .. I can see that, I always gettrouble with it tmortagne - (10:41): and certainly not blocker since you can configure it sburjan - (10:41): vmassol: attachments tab from the page bottom has an error when OOserver is started sburjan - (10:42): tmortagne: I was able to configure it ONLY as externally managed, and OO server started manually by me in console :( sburjan - (10:42): but no, it's not a blocker vmassol - (10:42): sdumitriu: when do we release? sburjan - (10:42): vmassol: this is the stack trace : http://pastebin.com/Wd7mMsfH tmortagne - (10:42): sburjan: you can configure the patch where oofice is tmortagne - (10:43): without it having to be setup as externally managerd tmortagne - (10:43): s:patch/path/ tmortagne - (10:43): sburjan: mflorea is already fixing the error tmortagne - (10:44): it's just a missing jar sburjan - (10:44): tmortagne: let me investigate that .. 30 minutes ago (before I switched to external) didn't worked mflorea - (10:44): sburjan: committed. should be fixed in the next snapshot sburjan - (10:45): mflorea: thanks, I'll check when snapshot will be  built tmortagne - (10:45): sburjan: you have openoffice.homePath and openoffice.profilePath sburjan - (10:45): I know sburjan - (10:46): what is your openoffice.homePath ? (I am running Ubuntu) mflorea - (10:46): sburjan: /usr/lib/openoffice/ mflorea - (10:46): you don't need the profilePath tmortagne - (10:46): i did not configured that since a very long time mflorea - (10:46): leave it commented sburjan - (10:47): I know I don't need profilePath mflorea - (10:47): ok sburjan - (10:47): sorinello@Phoenix:/usr/lib/openoffice$ ls sburjan - (10:47): basis3.2  basis-link  program  share mflorea - (10:47): yes sburjan - (10:48): shouldn't I point the path to the dir containing the bin file ? mflorea - (10:48): and use XWiki.OfficeImporterAdmin to connect to the OO server mflorea - (10:48): no sburjan - (10:48): oh .. let me try mflorea - (10:48): use just /usr/lib/openoffice mflorea - (10:48): use just /usr/lib/openoffice/ lucaa joined #xwiki at 10:48 sburjan - (10:48): I was using : /usr/lib/openoffice/program/ sburjan - (10:50): mflorea: yes, you are right. It works. Still odd it doesn't need t he path tothe bin dir sburjan - (10:51): mflorea: I wanted to test the Office Preview from Attachments Pane .. and this is how I found the error (missing jar) sburjan - (10:51): I say we souldn't release until I ca see that the fix works sburjan - (10:51): \*can mflorea - (10:52): should be fine in the next build mihaipaun left at 10:53 (Quit: Leaving. sburjan - (10:54): tmortagne: any Idea how could I test Extension Manager ? tmortagne - (10:54): sburjan: you have it in the admin UI tmortagne - (10:55): it only support jar for now so you can try to install a macro which is not by default in XWiki tmortagne - (10:55): a good one is ruby sburjan - (10:55): okay tmortagne - (10:55): let me find you the id sburjan - (10:55): okay tmortagne - (10:56): the id is org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-core-rendering-macro-ruby tmortagne - (10:57): by default extension manager comes with maven central repo and xwiki release repo so for the version you can use 2.4.3 for example sburjan - (10:58): I get a velocity error there  .. when pressing Resolve tmortagne - (10:58): sburjan: anyway don't need to block the release for extension manager, it's supposed to be experimental sburjan - (10:58): yeah rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 10:58 tmortagne - (10:58): sburjan: for now you get error when it can't resolve what you ask tmortagne - (10:58): it's not a bug tmortagne - (10:58): just a error reporting a bit lazy tmortagne - (10:58): look at the exact error sburjan - (10:59): need a stack ? tmortagne - (10:59): if you want tmortagne - (11:00): bu you can probably understand easily the error yourself sburjan - (11:00): http://pastebin.com/fC2Uupyr tmortagne - (11:02): sburjan: what did you put as id and version ? tmortagne - (11:02): the error says what you put is wrong tmortagne - (11:02): did you even put anything ? sburjan - (11:02): what should I put at version ? tmortagne - (11:02): (10:57:14 AM) tmortagne: by default extension manager comes with maven central repo and xwiki release repo so for the version you can use 2.4.3 for example sburjan - (11:07): well ... it resolves properly, I press install.. it tells me the following packages will be installed, I press install, I get redirected to the main Administration page, I go back to extensions, but there is nothing at the installed extensions. I also get this in console : 2010-10-01 12:01:40,641 [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=globaladmin§ion=Extensions] ERROR internal.DefaultVelocityEngine  - Except sburjan - (11:07): ion in macro #resolveExtension at xwiki:XWiki.XWikiPreferences[line 17, column 1] flaviusolaru left at 11:07 (Quit: Leaving. sburjan - (11:07): anyway ... this is not a priority now tmortagne - (11:08): hmm html issue i think, you can test with the real application on XWiki/ExtensionManager if you want sburjan - (11:08): someone should start the release notes .. so I can document them .. sburjan - (11:16): tmortagne: I'm gonna try searching on the JODConverter discussions list maybe I can find the issue we have.. and maybe come up with a fix tmortagne - (11:17): sburjan: the issue is probably that JODConverter does not not check which linux is that and where to find ooffice by default (which is not that easy) flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 11:18 tmortagne - (11:18): in windows you simply look at the registry sburjan - (11:18): then, it should use another way of detecting it. I have a bash script taken from niternet that does all the job for me sburjan - (11:19): IMO we're not the only ones that run Ubuntu .. or linux ... tmortagne - (11:19): sburjan: your script works whatever the system ? sburjan - (11:19): well .. myscript is bash... so it should run on any linux machine tmortagne - (11:20): execute yes but does not mean it's working on any linux, you probably have a header if you look in it which explain what it does and what it supports sburjan - (11:22): # Try to autodetect OOFFICE sburjan - (11:22): OOFFICE=`ls /usr/bin/openoffice.org /usr/bin/ooffice /usr/lib/openoffice.org/program/soffice | head -n 1` sburjan - (11:22): this line does the job .. at least on my machine tmortagne - (11:22): ok so it just have a list of possible path it knows and check all of them :) sburjan - (11:24): exactly :) sburjan - (11:24): maybe it's not so elegant, but it works :P tmortagne - (11:25): now i think JODConverter (or we) should at list print a warning saying it did not found ooffice path sburjan - (11:26): I'm gonna do some research . and see if others have this problem too. Other big companies use this library sburjan - (11:27): yes, we should print .. not everybody checks the console tmortagne - (11:28): at least we could say "you should have looked at the log" ;) sburjan - (11:28): yeah .... sburjan - (11:29): tmortagne: are you familiar with JODConverter source code ? I found a line that looks a little bit strange to me flaviusolaru left at 11:29 (Quit: Leaving. tmortagne - (11:29): sburjan: nop, never looked at it sburjan - (11:34): brb vmassol - (11:37): sdumitriu: when do we release? sdumitriu - (11:41): vmassol: Good morning vmassol - (11:45): good morning sergiu sdumitriu - (11:45): I finished fixing the failing tests yesterday sdumitriu - (11:45): Starting the mvn part in a few minutes vmassol - (11:45): ok cool vmassol - (11:45): so no more failing tests? sdumitriu - (11:45): Too bad we need to release the root pom again vmassol - (11:45): haven't checked, checking sdumitriu - (11:45): vmassol: There are a few, but I don't know what to do with those sdumitriu - (11:45): Works locally vmassol - (11:45): 7 failing vmassol - (11:45): excluding the csrf ones vmassol - (11:45): s/csrf/escaping/ flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 11:45 venkatesh left at 11:55 (Remote host closed the connection sburjan - (12:32): why do we have to release the root pom again ? vmassol - (12:34): sburjan: whenever there are changes toit sburjan - (12:35): but mflorea modified the root pom .. to include the missing jar ? sburjan - (12:36): or it was another change SvenDowideit left at 12:39 (Changing host SvenDowideit joined #xwiki at 12:39 venkatesh joined #xwiki at 12:48 venkatesh left at 12:49 (Read error: Connection reset by peer venkatesh joined #xwiki at 12:50 sburjan - (13:07): sdumitriu: ping sburjan - (13:08): can someone tell me how can I all the env variables from my linux ? sdumitriu - (13:08): sburjan: Pong sdumitriu - (13:08): You're missing a verb sdumitriu - (13:08): get? sburjan - (13:08): I am trying to begug the officeImporter problem sburjan - (13:08): get, print,see sburjan - (13:08): \*debug sburjan - (13:09): I wantto check I have a env variable set, and see if System.getProperty is able to see it sdumitriu - (13:09): env sburjan - (13:10): yeah sburjan - (13:10): great :) sburjan - (13:13): I just found why JODConverter isn't able to get the Open Office home path sburjan - (13:14): the fun part is .. we can't do nothing about it sdumitriu - (13:15): Why? sburjan - (13:17): because JODConverter has the  return new File("/opt/openoffice.org3"); hardcoded path if it can't get the System.getProperty("office.home"). and I have no env with office, nor OOO, nor nothing. So it's either a distro (ubuntu) thing, or I don;t know. Butthe problem isn't with JODConverter either. mflorea - (13:22): sburjan: what are you trying to do? sburjan - (13:23): to start OOServer in internal mode without modifying the xwiki.proprieties page. sburjan - (13:24): but it seem there is no other way, but just to edit the file and put manually the path mflorea - (13:24): what's "internal mode"? sburjan - (13:25): internal mode is when xwiki start OOserver by itself. mflorea - (13:25): I see sburjan - (13:25): OO Server doesnt put an env path to system, so all the apps that could use it, to get that path and start it in the background sburjan - (13:25): this thing will increase portability sburjan - (13:26): if all the linux family would have same PATH for OO.. or at least have that one sburjan - (13:27): so this is in Oracle's hands or in every distro maker sburjan - (13:27): EOF mflorea - (13:27): what's wrong with setting the path in xwiki.properties? sburjan - (13:28): nothing, just another step. Anyeay, we don't have any cohoice besides setting xwiki.proprieties sburjan - (13:28): maybe in future OO will introduce an ENV var mflorea - (13:28): I should be able to install OpenOffice where ever I want sburjan - (13:29): true .. but OO installer could set a env after installing sburjan - (13:29): and by doing this, you can install OO absolutely where you want .. while allowing other apps that use the OO server to run too sburjan - (13:29): IMO this would be the most elegant approach abusenius joined #xwiki at 13:46 sdumitriu - (13:50): vmassol, tmortagne: Shouldn't we create a jira project for XAEXTENSIONS? vmassol - (13:50): sdumitriu: it's in the core vmassol - (13:50): (if you mean the extension manager) vmassol - (13:50): oh the app vmassol - (13:50): ? tmortagne - (13:50): vmassol: sdumitriu mean the application i think sdumitriu - (13:50): I know it is, but there's also an app tmortagne - (13:50): and yes we should tmortagne - (13:50): i forgot sdumitriu - (13:50): The main part is in the core vmassol - (13:50): hmmm sdumitriu - (13:50): The app contains just one file vmassol - (13:51): yes probably unless we put it in the existing admin app tmortagne - (13:51): sdumitriu: only for now vmassol - (13:51): but yes sdumitriu - (13:51): It could be moved inside administration app tmortagne - (13:51): if will wontains a whole extension manager UI leter tmortagne - (13:51): later sdumitriu - (13:51): So we should create app, right? sdumitriu - (13:51): So we should create jira project for the app, right? tmortagne - (13:52): (01:50:41 PM) tmortagne: and yes we should sdumitriu - (13:52): K, I'll do it tmortagne - (13:54): i will modify the commits logs when you are done creating the project to put the proper jira issue instead of XWIKI-5518 jose\_\_ left at 14:06 (Quit: Leaving abusenius left at 14:24 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds sburjan - (15:07): mflorea: ping mflorea left at 15:11 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds mflorea joined #xwiki at 15:12 mflorea - (15:15): sdumitriu: did you release xwiki-core? sdumitriu - (15:15): Just started 5 seconds ago sdumitriu - (15:16): Should I stop? mflorea - (15:16): :( sdumitriu - (15:16): K, stopped mflorea - (15:16): I forgot to add a dependency sdumitriu - (15:16): (forgot to resolve snapshots sdumitriu - (15:16): Go on mflorea - (15:16): great, just a sec venkatesh left at 15:18 (Quit: Leaving mflorea - (15:20): sdumitriu: done. sorry for the delay mflorea - (15:20): sburjan: thanks for testing sburjan - (15:21): mflorea: no problem, it's my duty abusenius joined #xwiki at 15:37 jvdrean - (15:43): sdumitriu: I've just noticed that the background of logo.png (colibri) looks yellowish on my screen, could it be related to the recent images optimizations ? sdumitriu - (15:44): jvdrean: Screenshot? sdumitriu - (15:50): Hm... sdumitriu - (15:50): fmancinelli: Ping cjdelisle - (15:53): apache.commons.fileupload is pretty cool stuff, looking at replacing byte[] in XWikiAttachmentContent with FileItem si when it gets too big it spills over into tmp files. flaviusolaru left at 15:57 (Quit: Leaving. sdumitriu - (15:58): vmassol: Ping vmassol - (15:58): sdumitriu: yes? sdumitriu - (15:59): What's the standard for naming parent modules? Should it contain -parent? sdumitriu - (15:59): For example: sdumitriu - (15:59): xwiki-core-containers-parent sdumitriu - (15:59): But: sdumitriu - (15:59): xwiki-core-component vmassol - (16:00): yes we currently have various naming schemes vmassol - (16:01): I think I like the solution to name it after the directory ie withou the "parent" suffix vmassol - (16:01): but we need to vote/decide what we want sdumitriu - (16:01): K vmassol - (16:01): and then align our poms rrodriguez left at 16:03 (Quit: rrodriguez sdumitriu - (16:04): Releasing core kwoot left at 16:05 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds sdumitriu - (16:10): vmassol, tmortagne: extensions or extensions-manager? lucaa left at 16:10 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds vmassol - (16:10): extension or extensions for me vmassol - (16:11): (not sure about plural, we need to define a rule for that too… so many rules ;)) vmassol - (16:11): note that we had this discussion with thomas and we agreed on extension(s) vs extension-manager vmassol - (16:11): everything is a manager or a service vmassol - (16:11): so no need to add that information to the name vmassol - (16:12): xwiki- == the module in charge of tmortagne - (16:12): sdumitriu: for what do you need that ? sdumitriu - (16:13): The application tmortagne - (16:13): the application already have a name I don't understand tmortagne - (16:13): you mean on code.xwiki.org ? vmassol - (16:13): The Extension Application is fine with me and it's good that it has the same name as the module IMO vmassol - (16:14): (Extension or Extensions) cjdelisle - (16:15): +1 for non plural.
